medical_history.chief_complaint: Rusty colored urine, dysuria, increased urinary frequency/urgency, worsening pain and purulent drainage from a chronic left lower leg ulcer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior with rusty colored urine and dysuria, increased urinary frequency/urgency. The patient's left lower leg ulcer experienced worsening pain and purulent drainage. Additionally, the patient reported 3 days of subjective fevers, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Morbid obesity, Atrial fibrillation (AF) on warfarin, lymphedema, chronic venous stasis, recurrent cellulitis (MRSA and pseudomonas), history of recurrent DVT/PE, IgA nephropathy, iron deficiency anemia, mitral regurgitation, chronic pain, history of multi-drug resistant organisms, osteomyelitis.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of diabetes mellitus (DM) or hypertension (HTN). No family history of DVT/PE.
